CatDescriptText: Mr. John Nelson, Clark Street and Mr. William Singleton, washroom attendant, East Liberty, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 30, 1960, pg. 37 with question: "Do you think the religious issue will play a major role in the selection of the Democratic party's nominee for the Presidency of the United States?" Mr. John Nelson's answer reads: "Yes, I do...The reason there's never been a Catholic President."  Mr. William Singleton's answer reads: "It shouldn't...I can't say whether or not it will...I'm not that familiar with politics."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of John Nelson wearing dark hat, smoking cigar, standing on Liberty Avenue in front of Jenkins Arcade, Downtown; Portrait of William Singleton wearing moustache and dark necktie with star burst design and clip, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
